results.title: Melba
results.creator_credit: Seven Productions, Errol Sullivan, Pom Oliver and Rodney Fisher
results.brief_description: Nellie Melba (Linda Cropper) was the first Australian international “superstar”. King George V made her a Dame of the British Empire and lovers of singing world-wide idolised her. She achieved fame through a tenacity which took her from an obscure life to the leading stages of Europe and America, but she never once forgot her Australian roots. Melba’s private life was as dramatic and extraordinary as her public success. Her complexity matched her fame, as, season after season, she outshone her competitiors to rule the world of the stage for forty years. Featuring the voice of Yvonne Kenny as the Great Dame.

results.title: Melancholia
results.creator_credit: BFI, Colin MacCabe and Andi Engel
results.brief_description:
An existential political thriller that grapples with the legacy of post-1968 European political activism. A successful but angst ridden German art critic, established in London, is contacted by a student friend from the 1960s to assassinate a Chilean military torturer. Approaching a comfortable middle age, he is unsettled by the disruption which forces him to confront his political convictions and choose between the activism of his youth or the complacency and security of his present life. Filmed on location in London and Hamburg.

Credits: Producer, Colin McCabe ; director, Andi Engel ; writer, Andi Engel, Lewis Rodia ; phototography, Denis Crossan ; editing, Christopher Roth ; music, Simon Fisher Turner.
Cast: Jeroen Krabbe, Susannah York, Ulrich Wildgruber, Kate Hardie.

results.title: Mel Brooks, The Producers and the Ethics of Satire about N@zis

constellations_other.name: Undercutting extremism with absurdity
constellations_other.description: Taika Waititi's satirical performance as Adolf Hitler in Jojo Rabbit connects to a number of other portrayals that includes ill-fated (and conceived) TV shows, memes, high camp and cinema classics.

results.title_for_label: Mel Brooks, The Producers and the Ethics of Satire about N@zis

results.title: Mekong
results.brief_description: Under the aegis of the United nations Economic Commission for Asia and the Far East, 24 nations are participating in a project to harness the waters of the Mekong River to avoid floods, provide large scale controlled irrigation and power, and to make it navigable for 1,500 miles from Vientiane to the South China coast.

results.title: Meishu: travels in Chinese art. Part 3
results.brief_description: The Chinese identity Part 3 of a 3 part series travelling through China in search of the essence of Chinese art. This journey through China takes us to selected locations that embody the real and distinctive characterisation of the country and the symbols that represent its character.

results.title: Meishu: travels in Chinese art. Part 2
results.brief_description: China and the world Part 2 of a 3 part series travelling through China in search of the essence of Chinese art. This is the story of China’s spasmodic and invariably difficult contacts with other cultures and ideologies caused by both natural and cultural barriers and how this isolation has allowed China to develop its own great and distinctive traditions in art.

results.title: Meishu: travels in Chinese art. Part 1
results.brief_description: Canal boat to history Part 1 of a 3 part series travelling through China in search of the essence of Chinese art. This episode explores the problem of communication caused by China’s vast size and diversity of landscape and shows how this has been reflected in Chinese art through the ages.

results.title: Meiosis. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Acorn Films and William L. Claiborne
results.brief_description: Explains the processes of, and reasons for, meiosis. Stresses the importance of gamete formation for the continuation of life. Defines the role of the cell nucleus, centriole, chromosomes, chromatids and DNA in meiosis.

results.title: Meiosis
results.brief_description: An animated film showing meiosis, the chromosome halving cell division preceding the formation of sperms and egg cells. An introductory chart shows the production of male and female gametes and their union to form a new individual. The destruction between the chromosome complement of somatic cells and sperm cell or ovum is made. The process of meiotic division is illustrated by diagrams using, first, one set of chromosomes, and then again with four sets of chromosomes.

results.title: Mein kampf = My struggle
results.creator_credit: Minerva International, Tore Sjoberg and Erwin Leiser
results.brief_description: A documentary tracing the rise of the Nazi Party in Germany. The National Socialists effectively utilised film, radio and spectacle in order to create a propaganda involving the majority of Aryan, German-speaking people: a vast theatre of fascism and racism. The film traces the philosophical development of Hitler, as well as the history of World War II (including footage on the occupation of Poland, Czechoslavakia and France, and footage of the decisive battles of Stalingrad and Normandy). The most devastating material explores the fate of the Jewish people under Nazi occupation, including footage of the Warsaw Ghetto and the concentration camps where millions of Jews, political prisoners and “social deviants” were incarcerated and exterminated. It is the power of the stark black and white visuals which fully expose the inhumanity that underlied Nazi philosophy. WARNING: THIS VIDEO FEATURES DISTURBING AND CONFRONTING FOOTAGE OF WAR CRIMES PERPETUATED BY THE NAZI REGIME.
